sentences.sContent: Police have so far failed to establish a connection between the two murders.
sentences.sCn: 到目前为止警方尚未确定两宗凶杀案之间有关联。

sentences.sContent: The evidence was there in the file but no one made the connection .
sentences.sCn: 证据就在档案里，但没有人把它们联系起来。

sentences.sContent: Students often see little connection between school and the rest of their lives.
sentences.sCn: 学生往往看不到上学和今后生活的联系。

sentences.sContent: He demonstrated the close connection between social conditions and health.
sentences.sCn: 他证明了社会条件和健康之间的密切联系。

sentences.sContent: ...it is feasible with a connection to the internet...
...It’s no wonder that device we buy has a plug on the end of it or a wireless connection to internet soon...
...but too often at the expense of a connection with the present and future world beyond...
...The prime minister denied there was a connection between his news adviser’s outside interests and the change in legislative programme...
...Many studies have noted the connection between a happy mind and a healthy body - the happier you are...
...and now we are losing our connection to the machinery we depend on...
...That's why we establish or reestablish connection by greeting strangers and friends with a handshake...
...we lost our connection to the land...
...a New York University sociologist who has written about the connection of craft and culture...

phrases.pCn: 法兰接头；法兰联接；凸缘联接

words.tran: [计] 连接的；有联系的；连贯的

trans.tranCn: 连接； 联系； 连接物， 连接点； 亲戚
trans.tranOther: the way in which two facts, ideas, events etc are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other
